title: Element Symbols
description: Can you match chemical elements to their symbols?

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for Gold?
questions.explanation: Gold's chemical symbol is Au, derived from the Latin word 'aurum' meaning gold.

questions.question: What element does the symbol 'O' represent?
questions.explanation: O is the chemical symbol for Oxygen, the element essential for human respiration. It makes up about 21% of Earth's atmosphere.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for Iron?
questions.explanation: Iron's chemical symbol is Fe, from the Latin word 'ferrum.' Iron is the most common element on Earth by mass.

questions.question: Which element has the symbol 'Na'?
questions.explanation: Na is the symbol for Sodium, from the Latin word 'natrium.' Sodium is an essential mineral found in table salt (NaCl).

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for Carbon?
questions.explanation: Carbon's symbol is simply C. It is the basis of organic chemistry and is found in all known living organisms.

questions.question: What element does the symbol 'Ag' represent?
questions.explanation: Ag is the symbol for Silver, from the Latin word 'argentum.' Silver has been used in coins, jewelry, and photography.

questions.question: Which element has the symbol 'K'?
questions.explanation: K is the symbol for Potassium, from the Latin 'kalium.' Potassium is an essential mineral important for heart and muscle function.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for Mercury?
questions.explanation: Mercury's symbol is Hg, from the Latin 'hydrargyrum' meaning liquid silver. Mercury is the only metal that is liquid at room temperature.

questions.question: Which element has the symbol 'Pb'?
questions.explanation: Pb is the symbol for Lead, from the Latin word 'plumbum.' This is also the origin of the word 'plumbing,' as Romans used lead pipes.

questions.question: What element does the symbol 'Cu' represent?
questions.explanation: Cu is the symbol for Copper, from the Latin 'cuprum,' named after the island of Cyprus where it was mined in ancient times.

questions.question: Which element has the symbol 'Sn'?
questions.explanation: Sn is the symbol for Tin, from the Latin 'stannum.' Tin has been used since ancient times, notably in bronze (an alloy of tin and copper).

questions.question: What element does the symbol 'W' represent?
options: Both A and B are the same element
questions.explanation: W is the symbol for Tungsten, also known as Wolfram. The symbol comes from 'wolfram,' its older German name. Tungsten has the highest melting point of all elements.

questions.question: Which element has the symbol 'Sb'?
questions.explanation: Sb is the symbol for Antimony, from the Latin 'stibium.' Antimony has been known since ancient times and is used in flame-retardant materials.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for Xenon?
questions.explanation: Xenon's chemical symbol is Xe. It is a noble gas used in specialized lighting, such as flash lamps and arc lamps in IMAX projectors.

questions.question: Which element has the symbol 'Zr'?
questions.explanation: Zr is the symbol for Zirconium, a transition metal used in nuclear reactors due to its low absorption of neutrons. It is also used in dental crowns.
